description: A macrophage phagocytosis assay designed for use with recombinant, fluorescently labelled bacteria. This assay was optimised using recombinant GFP-labelled E. coli expressing eukaryotic-like proteins (ELPs) derived from sponge-symbionts.
protocol_affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia
affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

authors_list.name: Zahra Islam
authors_list.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data:
Perform all steps until microscope analysis in a Biosafety Class II Cabinet:
Seed RAW264.7 macrophage cells at 5x104 cells/well in a 12 well plate onto 18mm diameter glass coverslips (500µL cells per well supplemented with 1mL of fresh complete macrophage media). Plate cells out the day before phagocytosis experiment. Seed 4 wells per cell type (including the control). Incubate overnight in a 37oC/5% CO2 incubator
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Perform all steps until microscope analysis in a Biosafety Class II Cabinet:
Seed RAW264.7 macrophage cells at 5x104 cells/well in a 12 well plate onto 18mm diameter glass coverslips (500µL cells per well supplemented with 1mL of fresh complete macrophage media). Plate cells out the day before phagocytosis experiment. Seed 4 wells per cell type (including the control). Incubate overnight in a 37oC/5% CO2 incubator

components.data: Macrophage growth setup
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation:
Complete macrophage media: DMEM F12 HG + 10% foetal bovine serum (FBS) + 1% appropriate selection antibiotics (e.g. if the bacteria you will be using are resistant to kanamycin and ampicillin, add those to macrophage media. Otherwise use penicillin-streptomycin-glutamate [PSG]). 
Store at 4oC, warm to 37oC before use in assay.

Macrophages should be maintained on 10cm cell culture plates when not used in assay, stored in a 37oC/5% CO2 incubator; passaged every three days.
source_data.thread_text:

Store at 4oC, warm to 37oC before use in assay.

Macrophages should be maintained on 10cm cell culture plates when not used in assay, stored in a 37oC/5% CO2 incubator; passaged every three days.

Store at 4oC, warm to 37oC before use in assay.

source_data.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data: Grow up overnight cultures of bacteria (GFP labelled E. coli) day before phagocytosis experiment. 100µL stock in 100mL Luria Broth with appropriate selection antibiotics. Grow at 37oC in a shaking incubator to an OD600 of 1 (~108 cells/mL).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow up overnight cultures of bacteria (GFP labelled E. coli) day before phagocytosis experiment. 100µL stock in 100mL Luria Broth with appropriate selection antibiotics. Grow at 37oC in a shaking incubator to an OD600 of 1 (~108 cells/mL).

components.data: Bacterial growth setup
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation:
Luria Broth: 5g/L yeast extract + 5g/L NaCl + 10g/L peptone/tryptone + 1L milli Q water. Autoclave. Add antibiotics after media has cooled.

Antibiotics used: 100mg/L ampicillin and 50mg/L kanamycin

Store at 4oC
source_data.thread_text:

Antibiotics used: 100mg/L ampicillin and 50mg/L kanamycin

Store at 4oC

Store at 4oC
source_data.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data: Three hours before planned macrophage inoculation, sub-culture overnight bacterial culture to ensure bacteria are in early log-phase (1mL overnight culture + 9mL fresh Ab free LB). Induce cultures with 10% arabinose/100mM IPTG (~200µL/10mL bacterial culture) at 37oC in a shaking incubator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Three hours before planned macrophage inoculation, sub-culture overnight bacterial culture to ensure bacteria are in early log-phase (1mL overnight culture + 9mL fresh Ab free LB). Induce cultures with 10% arabinose/100mM IPTG (~200µL/10mL bacterial culture) at 37oC in a shaking incubator.

components.data: Bacterial growth setup
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation: Final concentration of arabinose should be 0.02%; final concentration of IPTG should be 2mM
source_data.thread_text: Final concentration of arabinose should be 0.02%; final concentration of IPTG should be 2mM
source_data.body: Final concentration of arabinose should be 0.02%; final concentration of IPTG should be 2mM
source_data.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data: Spin down bacterial culture for 5 minutes at 13,000g to pellet cells. Resuspend in appropriate amount of 1x PBS (dependent on required final concentration of bacteria + amount required for assay).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down bacterial culture for 5 minutes at 13,000g to pellet cells. Resuspend in appropriate amount of 1x PBS (dependent on required final concentration of bacteria + amount required for assay).

components.data: Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove macrophage media from the wells and replace with fresh media (500µL). Supplement GFP E. coli at a ratio of 10 cells/macrophage (~106 cells/mL, add 1mL). Don't add bacteria to control wells
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove macrophage media from the wells and replace with fresh media (500µL). Supplement GFP E. coli at a ratio of 10 cells/macrophage (~106 cells/mL, add 1mL). Don't add bacteria to control wells

components.data: Assay
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation: Final volume in each well should be 1.5mL, with 1 mL of bacterial culture and 500µL fresh complete macrophage media. There should be approximately 105 macrophages and 106 bacteria per mL.
source_data.thread_text: Final volume in each well should be 1.5mL, with 1 mL of bacterial culture and 500µL fresh complete macrophage media. There should be approximately 105 macrophages and 106 bacteria per mL.
source_data.body: Final volume in each well should be 1.5mL, with 1 mL of bacterial culture and 500µL fresh complete macrophage media. There should be approximately 105 macrophages and 106 bacteria per mL.
source_data.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data: Co-incubate cells for 1/8/24/48 hours (or other time intervals) at 37oC/5% CO2 to allow for bacterial uptake
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Co-incubate cells for 1/8/24/48 hours (or other time intervals) at 37oC/5% CO2 to allow for bacterial uptake

components.data: Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Stop phagocytosis by adding 550µL ice-cold PBS to the well. Aspirate supernatant using a pipette and then wash the cells three times with cold PBS (1mL/wash).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stop phagocytosis by adding 550µL ice-cold PBS to the well. Aspirate supernatant using a pipette and then wash the cells three times with cold PBS (1mL/wash).

components.data: Assay
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation: As macrophages are adherent cells, they should not be washed off during these washing steps as they should be attached to the glass coverslips. The washing steps aim to remove as much non-adherent bacteria as possible.
source_data.thread_text: As macrophages are adherent cells, they should not be washed off during these washing steps as they should be attached to the glass coverslips. The washing steps aim to remove as much non-adherent bacteria as possible.
source_data.body: As macrophages are adherent cells, they should not be washed off during these washing steps as they should be attached to the glass coverslips. The washing steps aim to remove as much non-adherent bacteria as possible.
source_data.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data: Transfer coverslips to a microscope slide with a drop of PBS (~6µL) using tweezers. Ensure the side with the macrophages attached is face down on the microscope slide.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer coverslips to a microscope slide with a drop of PBS (~6µL) using tweezers. Ensure the side with the macrophages attached is face down on the microscope slide.

components.data: Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Seal microscope slides using clear nail polish and allow to dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal microscope slides using clear nail polish and allow to dry.

components.data: Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Analyse cells using an upright fluorescent microscope to determine if the macrophages have phagocytosed the bacteria. Image 15 macrophages per coverslip x 4 replicates = 60 macrophages in total per treatment per time point.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Analyse cells using an upright fluorescent microscope to determine if the macrophages have phagocytosed the bacteria. Image 15 macrophages per coverslip x 4 replicates = 60 macrophages in total per treatment per time point.

components.data: Analysis
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation:
Microscope settings: 63x oil objective, green fluorescent protein (GFP)- differential interference contrast (DIC) combination channel. Microscope used: Leica DM5500B.

Images obtained using Leica DFC300 FC microscope camera and LAS V3 (version 3.2.0) software.
source_data.thread_text:
Microscope settings: 63x oil objective, green fluorescent protein (GFP)- differential interference contrast (DIC) combination channel. Microscope used: Leica DM5500B.

Images obtained using Leica DFC300 FC microscope camera and LAS V3 (version 3.2.0) software.
source_data.body:
Microscope settings: 63x oil objective, green fluorescent protein (GFP)- differential interference contrast (DIC) combination channel. Microscope used: Leica DM5500B.

Images obtained using Leica DFC300 FC microscope camera and LAS V3 (version 3.2.0) software.
source_data.affiliation: The University of New South Wales, Australia

components.data:
Parameters to investigate:

1) Percentage of macrophages containing bacteria 

2) Average number of intracellular bacteria per macrophage

Possible other parameters:

1) Percentage of macrophages with attached bacteria

2) Average number of attached bacteria per macrophage
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Parameters to investigate:

1) Percentage of macrophages containing bacteria 

2) Average number of intracellular bacteria per macrophage

Possible other parameters:

1) Percentage of macrophages with attached bacteria

2) Average number of attached bacteria per macrophage

components.data: Suggested Parameters to Analyse
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of Macrophage Phagocytosis Assay
source_data.annotation:
Statistical tests: two-way analysis of variances (ANOVA) to compare:

- Effect of treatmeent irrespective of time

- Effect of time irrespective of treatment

- Effect of treatment within each time, and the effect of time within each treatment (i.e. interaction between treatment and time)

Pairwise comparisons between each treatment and control using a Dunnetts test.
source_data.thread_text:
Statistical tests: two-way analysis of variances (ANOVA) to compare:

- Effect of treatmeent irrespective of time

- Effect of time irrespective of treatment

- Effect of treatment within each time, and the effect of time within each treatment (i.e. interaction between treatment and time)

Pairwise comparisons between each treatment and control using a Dunnetts test.

components.data:
Organisms:

  • RAW264.7 macrophages
  • GFP labelled Escherichia coli

Reagents:

  • 1x PBS
  • Dulbecco's Modified Eagle Medium (DMEM)/F12 Nutrient Mixture (containing L-glutamine, phenol red and high glucose) - ThermoFisher
  • Foetal Bovine Serum (FBS) - Bovogen
  • Ampicillin - 100mg/L
  • Kanamycin - 50mg/L
  • Luria Broth - 10g/L tryptone, 5g/L NaCl, 5g/L yeast extract - made up to 1L with milliQ water
  • 10% arabinose
  • 100mM IPTG

Equipment:

  • Static 12 well plastic plates
  • 10cm cell culture treated plates - Corning
  • 50mL Falcon tubes
  • 18mm diameter round glass coverslips
  • 37oC/5% CO2 incubator
  • 37oC shaking incubator
  • Tweezers
  • Glass microscope slides
  • Upright fluorescent microscope with GFP and phase contrast channels
  • Biosafety Class II cabinet
  • Spectrophotometer
  • Centrifuge
components.name: Description
